Text saved: In Britain, people spend a lot of money on new clothes.
Each person spends more than £1,000 every year.
This is about 4% of the money they get from their job.
This does not sound like a lot.
But it hides two big problems for people and for the world.

First, many people use credit cards to buy clothes.
They spend money they do not have.
British people now owe about £670 for each adult.
This money is for credit card companies.

Also, people are buying things they do not need.
Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes every year.
Most of these clothes go to big places for rubbish.
